metadata.title: USN-3891-1 -- systemd vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that systemd incorrectly handled certain D-Bus messages. A local unprivileged attacker could exploit this in order to crash the init process, resulting in a system denial-of-service (kernel panic).  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-3891-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  systemd-tests - 237-3ubuntu10.13 systemd-coredump - 237-3ubuntu10.13 systemd - 237-3ubuntu10.13 udev-udeb - 237-3ubuntu10.13 libsystemd0 - 237-3ubuntu10.13 systemd-container - 237-3ubuntu10.13 libnss-myhostname - 237-3ubuntu10.13 libudev1-udeb - 237-3ubuntu10.13 libudev1 - 237-3ubuntu10.13 libsystemd-dev - 237-3ubuntu10.13 libnss-systemd - 237-3ubuntu10.13 systemd-journal-remote - 237-3ubuntu10.13 libpam-systemd - 237-3ubuntu10.13 libudev-dev - 237-3ubuntu10.13 libnss-mymachines - 237-3ubuntu10.13 libnss-resolve - 237-3ubuntu10.13 systemd-sysv - 237-3ubuntu10.13 udev - 237-3ubuntu10.13 No subscription required
